commentary_central: ECB to cut for a third consecutive time in December. The data-dependent ECB is keen to ease policy with inflation data on track and greater worries about growth.
commentary_higher: ECB policymakers move slower as inflation fears return
commentary_lower: Euro area activity slows down significantly further because of weakening demand

commentary_central: Signs of consumer recovery remain muted following Christmas and ECB starts the year with one more quarter point cut
commentary_higher: Strong consumer trends emerge from Christmas sales and delay ECB loosening
commentary_lower: Disappointing Christmas sales arrive in combination with greater risks to growth from one of the external threats

commentary_central: The ECB wary of grwoth concerns front loads cuts with a third cut arriving at the June meeting
commentary_higher: Consumer recovery emerges stronger than expected, reigniting fears of inflation and prompting the ECB to proceed more cautiously
commentary_lower: Consumer led recovery fails to emerge and growth indicators continue to tick down, ECB cuts faster

commentary_central: The ECB will cut four times in 2025 altogether reaching a neutral rate during the year.
commentary_higher: Concerns about remaining inflationary pressure keep interest rates high along with a reluctance on the part of the ECB to reduce rates significantly.
commentary_lower: Consumer weakness becomes apparent and fears of undershooting become the primary driver of policy.

commentary_central: A continuation of monetary easing in the range of neutral rates.
commentary_higher: Concerns about remaining inflationary pressure keep interest rates high along with a reluctance on the part of the ECB to reduce rates significantly.
commentary_lower: The Eurozone economy weakens significantly, requiring the ECB to move into a zone that begins to stimulate demand.

commentary_central: A continuation of monetary easing in the range of neutral rates.
commentary_higher: Concerns about remaining inflationary pressure keep interest rates high along with a reluctance on the part of the ECB to reduce rates significantly.
commentary_lower: The Eurozone economy weakens significantly, requiring the ECB to move into a zone that begins to stimulate demand.

commentary_central: Interest rates converge on a rate similar to the expected inflation rate and lower than nominal GDP, due to stronger public finances and lower potential growth rates. The path towards these rates might be bumpy with long periods outside the range. Hence the low probability for a central scenario
commentary_higher: Stronger growth or a growing lack of confidence in Eurozone public finances would require a higher neutral interest rate. Strong growth because plentiful potential alternative investments allows savers to demand higher returns and weak public finances because government needs to attract more savings
commentary_lower: Weak growth and persistently low investment generates few outside options for savings, helping the longer-term interest rate to fall to low levels.
